meaningMnemonic: Ending with an い tells you that this word is an い-adjective. So since you know that the kanji <kanji>正</kanji> means "<kanji>correct</kanji>," what is the adjective version of that word? Well, it's also <vocabulary>correct</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
This word uses a reading you didn't learn from the kanji. You have to remember the ただ portion in order to read this word, so think about it this way:

After you get the answer <vocabulary>correct</vocabulary> a clown jumps out of nowhere yelling "<reading>Ta-da</reading> (ただ)!!!" Imagine it scaring the crap out of you, too.
